column3:
Zukin seeks to test your matchmaking skills.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Help the male striped ray launch bubbles at the female striped ray.
Mating season for striped rays is upon us. Their courtship rituals are long and complex, and begin with the male propelling a stream of sweet-smelling bubbles at an eligible female.
However, the females often reject attempts to impress them. The males become despondent as a result, so the ray handlers must encourage them to keep trying until they find a mate.
Over by Sui–no–Sato is a male ray who is reluctant to continue with the rituals. Perhaps you could assist his trainer?

Search for the female striped ray. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target the female striped ray and launch bubbles with <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(80),0))><UIForeground>F20222</UIForeground><UIForeground>01</UIForeground><Else/><CommandIcon(15)/> / <CommandIcon(8)/></If>.
Oh, what a pity! That was a fine attempt, but she's just not interested. She seems to turn away all the males though, not just our little friend here.
That was very nicely done, but he might need to try a few more times before she pays him any attention.
Look at that! This is the first time I've seen her show so much interest! She's ignored every other male until now.
Well, it looks like she's had enough for now. We'd better call it a day as well.
Our young friend here has made a lot of progress. His technique is slowly improving. Perhaps it won't be long before he finds a match!
Oh, are you here to help? I have spent all day training him, but he has become sullen and uncooperative. I think a fresh approach might do him some good. Would you like to try?
It would appear that the ray responded well to your instruction. The handler tells me that if he perseveres, he will find a mate sooner or later.

Striped rays are essential to our way of life, but pairing the males and females can be a little troublesome. In most cases, the males must attempt the mating ritual over and over before they succeed.
Since you have a knack for this, we may benefit from your help in the days to come.
The male stares into the distance. With the female gone, he seems at a loss.
We will stay here and continue practicing. I am sure that Zukin will be interested to hear how everything went. Fare you well!
